required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Combined Chelation Therapy in Patients With Transfusion Dependent Thalassemia and Iron Overload
clinical_study.official_title: Safety of Deferasirox (ICL670) and Deferoxamine (Desferal or DFO) Combined Chelation Therapy in Patients With Transfusion Dependent Thalassemia and Iron Overload

brief_summary.textblock: This is a pilot study looking at the safety and efficacy of giving combination chelation with deferasirox and deferoxamine. The hypothesis is that combination chelation is safe in decreasing overall iron in patients with thalassemia.

detailed_description.textblock: This was a phase two pilot clinical trial designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the combination of deferasirox and deferoxamine in transfusion dependent thalassemia with a range of systemic iron burden. The duration of combined therapy was 12 months. Changes in liver iron concentration, ferritin, myocardial iron, and serum creatinine was monitored.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of Combined Treatment With Deferasirox and Deferoxamine Over 12 Months
primary_outcome.description: Change in liver iron concentration from baseline to 12 months with the use of combined chelation therapy. The change was calculated as the liver iron concentration at 12 months minus the value at baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Serum Creatinine During 12 Months Combined Chelation Therapy
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of average serum creatinine over 12 months of combined chelation therapy compared with baseline serum creatinine.

arm_group.description: All subjects received Deferasirox (Exjade) and Deferoxamine (DFO) dosing based on the iron overload at baseline.

intervention.intervention_name: Combo Chelation with Deferasirox (Exjade) and Deferoxamine (DFO)
intervention.description: All subjects will be given Deferasirox 20-30 mg/kg for 7 days per week. All subject will be given Deferoxamine 50 mg/kg for 3-7 days per week. The number of days for Deferoxamine will be determined by liver iron concentration at baseline.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Transfusion Dependent Thalassemia
- If iron between 5-15 mg/g dry liver by SQUID, subject must have a documented endocrinopathy or cardiac finding
- Older than 8 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participating on another interventional clinical trial

results_reference.citation: Lal A, Porter J, Sweeters N, Ng V, Evans P, Neumayr L, Kurio G, Harmatz P, Vichinsky E. Combined chelation therapy with deferasirox and deferoxamine in thalassemia. Blood Cells Mol Dis. 2013 Feb;50(2):99-104. doi: 10.1016/j.bcmd.2012.10.006. Epub 2012 Nov 11.

group.title: Deferasirox (Exjade) and Deferoxamine (DFO)
group.description: Patients will receive combined chelation therapy using Deferasirox (Exjade) and Deferoxamine (DFO) with dosing based on liver iron concentration at baseline. Patients with moderate iron overload,defined as liver iron concentration of 5-15mg/g plus a documented endocrinopathy or cardiac iron (low MRI T2*), will receive 7 days per week of Deferasirox (Exjade) 20-30 mg/kg and Deferoxamine (DFO) 50 mg/kg 3-5 days per week. Patients with high iron overload, defined as liver iron concentration over 15mg/g will receive Deferasirox (Exjade) 20-30 mg/kg 7 days per week and Deferoxamine (DFO) 50 mg/kg 5-7 days per week.

group.title: Deferasirox (Exjade) and Deferoxamine (DFO)
group.description: Patients will receive combined chelation therapy using Deferasirox (Exjade) and Deferoxamine (DFO) with dosing based on liver iron concentration at baseline. Patients with moderate iron overload,defined as liver iron concentration of 5-15mg/g plus a documented endocrinopathy or cardiac iron (low MRI T2*), will receive 7 days per week of Deferasirox (Exjade) 20-30 mg/kg and Deferoxamine (DFO) 50 mg/kg 3-5 days per week. Patients with high iron overload, defined as liver iron concentration over 15mg/g will receive Deferasirox (Exjade) 20-30 mg/kg 7 days per week and Deferoxamine (DFO) 50 mg/kg 5-7 days per week.

outcome.title: Efficacy of Combined Treatment With Deferasirox and Deferoxamine Over 12 Months
outcome.description: Change in liver iron concentration from baseline to 12 months with the use of combined chelation therapy. The change was calculated as the liver iron concentration at 12 months minus the value at baseline.
outcome.population: Eighteen subjects completed one year of therapy. Four subjects did not complete the study for the following reasons: lost to follow-up (1), abdominal pain (1), death (1), and non-compliance (1).

group.title: Deferasirox (Exjade) and Desferal (DFO)
group.description: Subjects were treated with Deferasirox (Exjade) and Desferal (DFO) with dosing based on baseline iron overload.

measure.title: Efficacy of Combined Treatment With Deferasirox and Deferoxamine Over 12 Months
measure.description: Change in liver iron concentration from baseline to 12 months with the use of combined chelation therapy. The change was calculated as the liver iron concentration at 12 months minus the value at baseline.
measure.population: Eighteen subjects completed one year of therapy. Four subjects did not complete the study for the following reasons: lost to follow-up (1), abdominal pain (1), death (1), and non-compliance (1).

outcome.title: Change in Serum Creatinine During 12 Months Combined Chelation Therapy
outcome.description: Comparison of average serum creatinine over 12 months of combined chelation therapy compared with baseline serum creatinine.

group.title: Deferasirox (Exjade) and Desferal (DFO)
group.description: Subjects were treated with Deferasirox (Exjade) and Desferal (DFO) with dosing based on baseline iron overload.

measure.title: Change in Serum Creatinine During 12 Months Combined Chelation Therapy
measure.description: Comparison of average serum creatinine over 12 months of combined chelation therapy compared with baseline serum creatinine.

group.title: Deferasirox (Exjade) and Deferoxamine (DFO)
group.description: Treatment with Deferasirox (Exjade) and Deferoxamine (DFO) with dosing based on baseline iron overload.

event.description: Baseline liver iron 24.6 mg/g, cardiac MRI T2* 4.8 ms, ejection fraction 67%. Two months into the study, presented to ER with abdominal pain, ascites, diarrhea, and leukocytosis. Expired during emergency colectomy from cardiac arrhythmias

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: Children's Hospital & Research Center at Oakland
